# NSAttributedString.TextHighlightColorScheme

**Structure**

Constants that specify the highlight color to use with the text.

## Declaration

```swift
struct TextHighlightColorScheme
```

## Overview

Use an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSAttributedString/TextHighlightColorScheme] structure as the value of the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSAttributedString/Key/textHighlightColorScheme] attribute. That attribute specifies which color to use when drawing the highlight on the text. This attribute specifies only the color option. To display the highlight itself, add the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSAttributedString/Key/textHighlightStyle] attribute to the text.

## Getting the color schemes

- **default**: The default system highlight color.
- **blue**: A blue highlight color.
- **mint**: A mint green highlight color.
- **orange**: An orange highlight color.
- **pink**: A pink highlight color.
- **purple**: A purple highlight color.

## Creating a color scheme

- **init(_:)**
- **init(rawValue:)**

## Getting text content attributes

- **NSAttributedString.Key**: The attributes you apply to ranges of characters in an attributed string.
- **NSAttributedString.TextHighlightStyle**: Constants that specify the type of highlight to apply to text.
- **NSAttributedString.TextEffectStyle**: Constants for the type of effect to apply to the text.
- **NSAttributedString.SpellingState**: Constants for the spelling state attribute key.
- **NSUnderlineStyle**: Constants for the underline style and strikethrough style attribute keys.
- **NSWritingDirectionFormatType**: Constants for the writing direction attribute key.
